name: Barre Salvation Army
description: The Barre Salvation Army operates an emergency food shelf and a soup kitchen Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 11:45am to 1pm.

name: Bethel Area Food Shelf
description:
The mission of the Bethel Food Shelf is to provide supplemental and emergency food assistance to Barnard, Bethel, Gaysville, Pittsfield, and Stockbridge, Vermont residents in need.

Pantry hours: Monday: 12pm -2pm and Wednesdays 4pm -6pm.

name: Brattleboro Area Drop-In Center
description: The Brattleboro Area Drop In Center is a day shelter open to all persons within the Brattleboro area. We offer a welcoming atmosphere, community food shelf, support services, and a place where homeless and lonely persons can come.

name: BROC Rutland Food Shelf
description:
BROC's Rutland Food Shelf provides commodities to help many people to avoid running out of food from month to month. Commodities include food items such as canned vegetables and fruits, packaged fruits, pasta products, cereals, peanut butter, dry milk and more. Items will vary during the year. Income eligible households can receive commodities on a monthly basis.

Nutrition Education is offered, including one to one counseling. We use a curriculum called "Financial Fitness" that emphasizes basic budgeting, family communication around spending decisions and smart shopping. This information and instruction is aimed at helping people more effectively meet their family's nutritional needs by using their financial resources carefully.

name: Burlington Salvation Army
description:
Meals are offered to anyone in need Monday - Saturday at 5:00-6:00pm. Meals are often prepared by groups, churches, companies and individuals; bringing food or preparing on site. Preparation time begins usually at 4pm.

The Food Pantry is open by appointment Monday through Friday, 9:00am to 12:00 noon. For an appointment please call Captain William Thompson at (802) 864-6991 or by email.

name: Charlotte Food Shelf
description: The Charlotte Food Shelf and Assistance is open from 7:30 to 9:30am on Thursdays.

name: Chittenden Emergency Food Shelf
description:
The Chittenden Emergency Food Shelf works to alleviate hunger by feeding people and cultivating opportunities. As the largest direct service emergency food provider in Vermont, CEFS serves over 12,000 people each year.

The CEFS food shelf is open from 9:00am to 4:00pm, Monday through Friday.

name: Community Food Cupboard
description: he Community Food Cupboard, provides nutritious food to people in need in the Northshire. Food is distributed each Tuesday from 10:00 a.m. until noon, and 2:00pm until 4:00 and Wednesday from 2:00pm until 4:00pm.

name: CVCAC Barre Food Shelf
description:
Partnerships with the Vermont Foodbank and Food Works at Two Rivers Center provide access to a variety of staples, canned goods, dairy products, some meats and fresh produce in season. Private donations of food items help support our efforts as do gifts of cash that help defray costs of food purchases.

The food shelf is open Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 9am to noon and 1-3pm.

name: Danville Ecumenical Community Center Food Shelf
Faith In Action Northern Communities Partnership
Franklin/Grand Isle Community Action (FGICA)
description: The hours are 1:00 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. Monday through Friday except holidays. Over 450 families receive a 3 day supply of emergency food each month. FGICA also operates food shelves at their outreach offices in Richford and Grand Isle.

name: Hardwick Area Food Pantry
description: Food pantry.

name: HOPE - Helping Overcome Poverty's Effects
description: HOPE provides community-based poverty relief services to Addison County residents. Our programs include a food shelf, a farmer supported produce gleaning operation, low-income housing development, and Retro-Works, a charity resale shop and warehouse.

name: Johnson Food Shelf
description: Open Tuesdays and Fridays 9:00am to 12:00pm

name: Lamoille Community Food Share
description: We are a nonprofit group of volunteers dedicated to providing food security for our friends and neighbors in and around Lamoille County. We supply our pantry through donations  of food and cash.

name: Loaves &  Fishes
description: Loaves & Fishes community kitchen offers meals to anyone in need of one, Tuesdays and Fridays, at 11:30am - 12:30pm.

name: Lyndon Area Food Shelf
description: Food pantry service hours: Wednesdays 1:30pm -4pm.

name: Montpelier Food Pantry
description:
The Montpelier Food Pantry serves emergency meals to individuals and families in the greater Montpelier area.  We assist people who are in need of life’s necessities and social justice.  We promote self-sufficiency and food independence through food education.

Pantry Hours: Tuesday 10-12, Wednesday 10-11 & 5-6 pm, Thursday & Friday 10-11.

name: Onion River Food Shelf
description: Serves Marshfield, Plainfield, Cabot, Calais, and East Montpelier areas. Hours: 10am to 2pm.

name: Our Place Drop-In Center
description:
Our Place Drop-In Center has been serving the community surrounding Bellows Falls, Vermont for nearly 20 years. Our mission is simple: “Connecting people to food and each other.” 

Our Place is open Monday through Friday. Breakfast is served 9-10:30 a.m. and lunch from 11:30-12:45.

The food shelf is open Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. – 4 p.m.

name: Thetford Food Shelf
description: Serves Thetford and surrounding areas. Hours: Tuesday and Thursday from 10am to 12pm.

name: Victory Baptist Church
description: Victory Baptist Church provides a food pantry for the Vergennes area.

name: Willing Hands
description: Willing Hands recovers surplus fruits and vegetables and delivers  to organizations serving our neighbors in need. We work within a 30 mile radius of White River Junction, operate seven days a week all year round, and deliver on average about 4 tons of food each week.  We pick up surplus from grocers, farmers, bakers and chefs and deliver to foodshelves, community meals, rehab programs and directly to seniors and families living in subsidized housing . We provide all of our services free of charge.

users.title: Chief of Programs and Network Services
Director of Communications and Public Affairs
Program Manager
users.bio: I am a manager of local food system initiatives at the Vermont Foodbank, including the Gleaning Program, Pick for Your Neighbor, and Community Kitchen Academy. These programs aim to make local fresh foods accessible to Vermonters-in-need via 280 partnering organizations including foodshelves, community meal sites, senior centers, and after school programs.

name: Vermont Foodbank
description: The mission of the Vermont Foodbank is to gather and share quality food and nurture partnerships so that no one in Vermont will go hungry.

users.title: President
users.bio: I am a buyer for the Reading/West Windsor Food Shelf
